fullText:
https://www.wsj.com/articles/lempicka-review-broadway-musical-eden-espinosa-rachel-chavkin-519b3aca

Eden Espinosa Photo: Matthew MurphyNew York

“Never let them see your brushstrokes,” admonishes the title character, the painter Tamara de Lempicka, in the Broadway musical based on her life. Unhappily, “Lempicka” often seems to be all visible brushstrokes, a neatly constructed but surprisingly conventional show that turns the wild, imperious and wayward woman into a fairly standard-issue heroine, enduring trauma and searching for lasting love while also trying to assert her identity as an artist.

llmScore.reasoning: Claude: The review criticizes the show as conventional and predictable, reducing a fascinating historical figure to standard musical theater tropes, with visible structural problems. | GPT-4o-mini: The review expresses significant reservations about the show's conventionality and characterization, leading to a mixed recommendation.
